DataElement.preferredName: Highest Weight since Age 18 years Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Highest weight since age 18_The numerical result of the determination of the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity using the following format:__lbs__oz.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Approaching or constituting a maximum; the highest point (of something).:The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: Approaching or constituting a maximum; the highest point (of something).
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Property.preferredDefinition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::18:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The numerical result of the determination of the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity using the following format:__lbs__oz.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:A traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: NINDS:National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke Common Data Element Project
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 5/29/18 - smt CDE transferred to NCIP ownership per NINDS (Muniza Sheikh) request.
